headline: Why The Trade Desk (TTD) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of digital advertising platform The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) jumped 2.6% in the morning session after reports showed that Cathie Wood's ARK Investment funds bought a significant number of shares in the company. Disclosures from the investment firm revealed the acquisition of 204,354 shares, a purchase valued at approximately $7.9 million. This move highlighted ARK's strong confidence in the company's growth potential within the evolving online ad market. The investment followed recent comp

headline: 2 Oversold Stocks Primed to Rebound and 1 Facing Headwinds
summary: The past year hasn't been kind to the stocks featured in this article. Each has tumbled to their lowest points in 12 months, leaving investors to decide whether they're witnessing fire sales or falling knives.

headline: The Trade Desk (TTD) Tumbled on Softer Than Expected Guidance
summary: Harding Loevner, an asset management company, released its “Global Equity Strategy” third-quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. The fund returned 2.62% gross (2.52% net) in the third quarter of 2025, compared to a 7.74% return for the MSCI All Country World Index and 7.36% gain for the MSCI […]

headline: The Trade Desk: Market Share Losses Continue, Nothing Else Matters
summary: The Trade Desk, Inc.'s revenue growth is decelerating, with Q4 guidance at a disappointing 13%. Click here to read why TTD stock is a Hold.
